member.name: M:WildHare.CharExtensions.CharAt(System.String,System.Int32)
member.summary: Returns the character at the position {i}.

member.name: M:WildHare.CharExtensions.IsLetter(System.Char)
member.summary: Inline version of char.IsLetterOrDigit(ch). ie: A-Z, a-z, and letters of other alphabets

member.name: M:WildHare.CharExtensions.IsLetterOrDigit(System.Char)
member.summary: Inline version of char.IsLetterOrDigit(ch). ie: Letters plus digits

member.name: M:WildHare.CharExtensions.IsUpper(System.Char)
member.summary: Inline version of char.IsUpper(ch). ie: Uppercase letters

member.name: M:WildHare.CharExtensions.IsLower(System.Char)

member.name: M:WildHare.CharExtensions.IsPunctuation(System.Char)
member.summary: Inline version of char.IsPunctuation(ch). ie: Symbols used for punctuation in Western and other alphabets

member.name: M:WildHare.CharExtensions.IsNumber(System.Char)
member.summary: Inline version of char.IsNumber(ch). ie: All digits plus Unicode fractions and Roman numeral symbols

member.name: M:WildHare.CharExtensions.IsDigit(System.Char)
member.summary: Inline version of char.IsDigit(ch). ie: 0-9 plus digits of other alphabets

member.name: M:WildHare.CharExtensions.IsWhiteSpace(System.Char)
member.summary: Inline version of char.IsWhiteSpace(ch). ie: All separators plus \n, \r, \t, \f, and \v

member.name: M:WildHare.CharExtensions.IsSymbol(System.Char)
member.summary: Inline version of char.IsSymbol(ch). ie: Most other printable symbols

member.name: M:WildHare.CharExtensions.IsControl(System.Char)
member.summary: Inline version of char.IsControl(ch). ie: Non-printable "control" characters below 0x20, such as \r, \n, \r, and \0, and characters between 0x7F and 0x9A

member.name: M:WildHare.CharExtensions.IsSeparator(System.Char)
member.summary: Inline version of char.IsSeparator(ch). in: Space plus all Unicode separator characters

member.name: M:WildHare.CharExtensions.GetUnicodeCategory(System.Char)

member.name: M:WildHare.Extensions.ConvertExtensions.ToIntArray(System.String,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Converts a string to an array of ints. With {strict} equals false, the default, the method will ignore any characters except for numbers, the negative symbol, or commas. With {strict} equals true, empty entries, alphabetic characters, etc. will cause exceptions.

member.summary: Converts a DataTable to a list of T

member.name: M:WildHare.Extensions.DateTimeExtensions.GetNextDayOfWeek(System.DateTime,System.DayOfWeek,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Given a DateTime like {date}, gets the next {DayOfWeek}, like Sunday, Saturday, etc. as DateTime. If {includeDate} is true and {date} is that day of the week, then return that {date}.
member.example: Given {date} is 1/1/2020 (Wednesday) then date.GetNextDayOfWeek(DayOfTheWeek.Wednesday) returns the next Wednesday which is 1/8/2020. If {includeDate} is true then 1/1/2020.

member.name: M:WildHare.Extensions.DateTimeExtensions.FirstDayOfTheMonth(System.DateTime)

member.name: M:WildHare.Extensions.DateTimeExtensions.FirstDayOfNextMonth(System.DateTime)

member.name: M:WildHare.Extensions.DateTimeExtensions.LastDayOfTheMonth(System.DateTime)
member.summary: Gets a DateTime for the last day of the next month for the given {datetime}.

member.name: M:WildHare.Extensions.DateTimeExtensions.IsInTheSameMonth(System.DateTime,System.DateTime)
member.summary: Returns a boolean true if the {datetime} and {target} are in the same month.

member.name: M:WildHare.Extensions.DateTimeExtensions.TodayOrBefore(System.DateTime)
member.summary: Returns a boolean true if the {datetime} is today or before.

member.name: M:WildHare.Extensions.Xtra.XtraExtensions.GetXmlDocumentation(System.String,System.Reflection.Assembly)
member.summary: (EXPERIMENTAL) Returns a list Xml Documentation elements. Enable in VS by checking the Properties/Build/Enable Xml Documentation checkbox. On build, an XML file is generated to the file location with all the /// comments (like this one) that have been written in the your code.

member.summary: (EXPERIMENTAL) Gets the root path of an application. This can have different meanings it different types of applications, so check that your usage fully meets your needs before proceeding...

member.name: M:WildHare.Extensions.IEnumerableExtensions.ElementIn``1(System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{``0},System.Int32)
member.summary: Takes the element in the list at the position of {index} looping around to the beginning of the list if the index is outside of the number of items in the list. Will always return an element unless there are no elements in the list, in which case it returns an exception.

member.name: M:WildHare.Extensions.IEnumerableExtensions.ElementInOrDefault``1(System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{``0},System.Int32)
member.summary: Takes the element in the list at the position of {index} looping around to the beginning of the list if the index is outside of the number of items in the list. Will always return an element unless there are no elements in the list, in which case it returns the type default value.

member.name: M:WildHare.Extensions.IEnumerableExtensions.MatchList``2(System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{``0},System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{``1},System.Func{``0,``1,System.Boolean},System.Boolean)
member.summary: Given two lists it returns values from first if the {func} is true. If {consecutive} is false, continues returning values until one of the lists has no more elements.

member.name: M:WildHare.Extensions.IEnumerableExtensions.Sequence``2(System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{``0},System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{``1},System.Func{``0,``1,System.Boolean},System.Boolean)
member.summary: Given two lists returns the values from first if func is true. If {consecutive} is false continues until one of the lists has no more elements.

member.summary: Converts IEnumerable to Collection of type parameter. Returns an empty Collection rather than failing if enumerable is null.

member.name: T:WildHare.Extensions.IListExtensions
member.summary: Class Summary

member.name: M:WildHare.Extensions.IListExtensions.TakeRandom``1(System.Collections.Generic.IList{``0},System.Int32,System.Random,System.Boolean)
member.summary:
Will randomly return a list of items from the {sourceList} equal to the {count} (up to the number in the list).
If the {count} is not specified, it will return one. If {remove} is true, the items are removed from the {sourceList}.

member.name: M:WildHare.Extensions.IListExtensions.TakeRandomOne``1(System.Collections.Generic.IList{``0},System.Random,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Will randomly return a single item from the {sourceList}. If {remove} is true, the item is removed from the {sourceList}.

member.name: M:WildHare.Extensions.IListExtensions.TakeNext``1(System.Collections.Generic.IList{``0},System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Boolean)
member.summary:
Will return a sequencial list of items from the {sourceList} equal to the {count}(up to the number remaining in the list).
If the {count} is not specified, it will return one. If {remove} is true, the items are removed from the {sourceList}. If {offset} > 0, it will skip this number of records but will loop back to the beginning if necessary and elements exist.

member.name: M:WildHare.Extensions.IListExtensions.TakeNextOne``1(System.Collections.Generic.IList{``0},System.Int32,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Will return a single item from the {sourceList} If {remove} is true, the item is removed from the {sourceList}. If {offset} > 0, it will skip this number of records but will loop back to the beginning if necessary and elements exist.

member.name: M:WildHare.Extensions.IListExtensions.NextIn``1(``0,System.Collections.Generic.IList{``0})
member.summary: Given an item in a list, it will return the next item in the list or the default for that type (usually null if non-numeric). Uses IndexOf, which will return the first element for simple numeric types

member.name: M:WildHare.Extensions.IListExtensions.PreviousIn``1(``0,System.Collections.Generic.IList{``0})
member.summary: Given an item in a list, it will return the Prevous item in the list or the default for that type (usually null if non-numeric). Uses IndexOf, which will return the first element for simple numeric types

member.name: M:WildHare.Extensions.IOExtensions.WriteToFile(System.String,System.String,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Writes the {stringToWrite} to the {fileName} string. If {overwrite} is true, it will overwrite existing file returning a success boolean. It will create the file if it does not existe.

member.name: M:WildHare.Extensions.IOExtensions.WriteToFile(System.String,System.IO.FileInfo,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Writes the {stringToWrite} to the {fileName} FileInfo. If {overwrite} is true, it will overwrite existing file returning a success boolean. It will create the file if it does not exist.

member.name: M:WildHare.Extensions.IOExtensions.AppendToFile(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Writes the {stringToWrite} to the end of the {fileName} content, returning true or false.

member.name: M:WildHare.Extensions.IOExtensions.AppendToFile(System.String,System.IO.FileInfo)
member.summary: Writes the {stringToWrite} to the end of the {fileName} FileInfo content, returning true or false.

member.summary: Gets a recursive list of FileSystemInfos (both directories and files) to a depth of {maxDepth}. Defaults to a depth of 2.

member.summary: Gets a list of all files matching the {searchPattern} in current directory and all subdirectories.

member.summary: Gets the string content from a System.Io.FileInfo. If {strict} is true (the default), will throw an exception if the file is not found. If {strict} is false, will return null.

member.summary: Inline version of string.IsNullOrWhiteSpace()

member.summary: Inline version of to test for null

member.summary: A null string returns {replacement} if given, else an empty string.

member.summary: A null or empty string returns {replacement} if given, else an empty string.

member.name: M:WildHare.Extensions.StringExtensions.IfNullOrSpace(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: A Null or whitespace string returns {replacement} if given, else an empty string.

member.name: M:WildHare.Extensions.StringExtensions.RemoveStart(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Remove the start of a string if it exactly matches {start}.

member.name: M:WildHare.Extensions.StringExtensions.RemoveEnd(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Remove the end of a string if it exactly matches {end}.

member.name: M:WildHare.Extensions.StringExtensions.RemoveStartEnd(System.String,System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Remove the start of a string if it matches {start} and end of a string if it matches {end}. If {end} is not specified use {start} for both values.

member.name: M:WildHare.Extensions.StringExtensions.RemoveStart(System.String,System.String[])
member.summary: Removes the start of a string if it exactly matches any of the strings in the {startArray}.

member.name: M:WildHare.Extensions.StringExtensions.RemoveEnd(System.String,System.String[])
member.summary: Removes the end of a string if it exactly matches any of the strings in the {endArray}.

member.name: M:WildHare.Extensions.StringExtensions.RemoveStartEnd(System.String,System.String[],System.String[])
member.summary: Removes the start of a string if it exactly matches any of the strings in the {startArray} and removse the end of a string if it exactly matches any of the strings in the {endArray}.

member.name: M:WildHare.Extensions.StringExtensions.RemoveStartFromAllLines(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Remove the start of line if it exactly matches {start} for all lines in the string. Normalizes all line returns to Environment.NewLine. This can be useful for programmatically removing indents from long strings.

member.name: M:WildHare.Extensions.StringExtensions.RemoveStartFromAllLines(System.String,System.String[])
member.summary: Remove the start of line if it exactly matches any string in the {startArray} for all lines in the string. Normalizes all line returns to Environment.NewLine. This can be useful for programmatically removing indents from long strings.

member.name: M:WildHare.Extensions.StringExtensions.RemoveEndFromAllLines(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Remove the end of line if it exactly matches {end} for all lines in the string. Normalizes all line returns to Environment.NewLine.

member.name: M:WildHare.Extensions.StringExtensions.RemoveEndFromAllLines(System.String,System.String[])
member.summary: Remove the end of line if it exactly matches any string in the {endArray} for all lines in the string. Normalizes all line returns to Environment.NewLine.

member.name: M:WildHare.Extensions.StringExtensions.RemoveIndents(System.String,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Removes the indent from all lines of text in a string using the indent from the second line of text in the string as the indent to remove. The first line is typically where the verbatim and/or interpolation is declared and does not have an indent and so is skipped. If {removeInitialSpaces} is true (the default), it removes the first line if it only contains whitespace.

member.name: M:WildHare.Extensions.StringExtensions.GetStartWhitespaces(System.String)
member.summary: Gets the all the whitespace at the beginning of a string.

member.name: M:WildHare.Extensions.StringExtensions.AddStart(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Adds {addToStart} to the beginning of the string if string {s} is not NULL or EMPTY.

member.name: M:WildHare.Extensions.StringExtensions.AddEnd(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Adds {addToEnd} to the end of the string if string {s} is not NULL or EMPTY.

member.name: M:WildHare.Extensions.StringExtensions.AddStartEnd(System.String,System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Adds {addToStart} to the beginning of the string and {addToEnd} to the end of the string {s} if is not NULL or EMPTY. If {addToEnd} is NULL, adds {addToStart} to both the start and end..

member.name: M:WildHare.Extensions.StringExtensions.EnsureStart(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Adds {addToStart} to the beginning of the string UNLESS it already starts with that string.

member.name: M:WildHare.Extensions.StringExtensions.EnsureEnd(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Adds {addToEnd} to the end of the string UNLESS it already starts with that string.

member.name: M:WildHare.Extensions.StringExtensions.EnsureStartEnd(System.String,System.String,System.String)
M:WildHare.Extensions.StringExtensions.GetStart(System.String,System.String,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Splits string into an array based on {separator} and returns the start element. Includes the separator if {includeSeparator} is true and it is contained in the string.

member.name: M:WildHare.Extensions.StringExtensions.GetEnd(System.String,System.String,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Splits string into an array based on {separator} and returns the end element. Includes the separator if {includeSeparator} is true and it is contained in the string.

member.name: M:WildHare.Extensions.StringExtensions.NumbersOnly(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Returns a string with only numbers and any additional characters in {otherCharacters}.

member.name: M:WildHare.Extensions.StringExtensions.LettersOnly(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Returns a string with only letters and any additional characters in {otherCharacters}.

member.name: M:WildHare.Extensions.StringExtensions.Truncate(System.String,System.Int32,System.String,System.Int32)
member.summary: Truncates a string down if it is over {maxcharacters}. If truncated it adds {more} parameter to the end with '...' as the default. It will attempt to make the truncation at a space or line break, but will search {wordcut} characters before forcing the wordcut.

member.name: M:WildHare.Extensions.StringExtensions.ProperCase(System.String,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Capitalizes the first letter and all first letters after whitespace in a string. If {underscoreCountsAsSpace} is true then also capitalizes the first letter after an underscore '_'.

member.name: M:WildHare.Extensions.StringExtensions.IncrementString(System.String,System.Nullable{System.Int32},System.String,System.Int32)
member.summary: Increments integer +1 on the end of a string. IF the string does not contain an integer then will use {seedIfEmpty}. You can specify a file extension at the end to ignore using {ignoreExtension}. If needed, you can set a value for {increment} to be other than 1.

member.name: M:WildHare.Extensions.StringExtensions.Repeat(System.String,System.Int32)
member.summary: Returns a string {str} x {number} of times

member.name: M:WildHare.Extensions.StringExtensions.StartsWith(System.String,System.String[],System.Boolean,System.Globalization.CultureInfo)
member.summary: An overload of StartsWith that accepts a string array. Will return true if any of the values in the {valuesArray} is true.

members.member: An overload of Replace that accepts a string array. For the supplied string, replaces all values in the {oldValues} array with the {newValue} string. Shortcut for y.Replace("cat", "").Replace("dog", "") etc....

member.name: M:WildHare.Extensions.StringExtensions.Replace(System.String,System.Collections.Generic.Dictionary{System.String,System.String},System.Boolean)
member.summary: An overload of Replace that accepts a Dictionary of string,string. For the supplied string, replaces all instances in the matching the dictionary key with the dictionary value If {reverse} is true, replaces the matching dictionary value with the dictionary key.

members.member: An overload of Replace that accepts a string array. For the supplied string, replaces all values in the {oldValues} array with those in {newValues} array. Shortcut for y.Replace("cat", "frog").Replace("dog", "bird") etc....

member.name: M:WildHare.Extensions.StringExtensions.Split(System.String,System.String,System.StringSplitOptions)
member.summary: An overload of Split that accepts a single string as separator.

member.name: M:WildHare.Extensions.StringExtensions.Ignore(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Ignores string by returning null if the string {str} equals {str2}.
member.example: string field = "*"; var f = field.Ignore("*") ?? "Empty" ex: return "Empty"

member.name: M:WildHare.Extensions.StringExtensions.SingularOrPlural(System.Int32,System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Will return the {singular} form of a word if {number} is equal to 1, otherwise returns {plural}. For simple cases, it will add an "s" to the end (or an "es" if {singular} ends in "s","x","ch","sh","z", or "o") if {plural} is omitted.

member.name: M:WildHare.Extensions.ForTemplating.TemplatingExtensions.TSqlTypeToCSharpType(System.String,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Converts a TSQL type name to a C# type name. It will remove the "System." namespace, if present

member.name: M:WildHare.Extensions.ForTemplating.TemplatingExtensions.DotNetTypeToCSharpType(System.String,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Converts a .Net type name to a C# type name. It will remove the "System." namespace, if present

member.name: M:WildHare.Extensions.ForTemplating.TemplatingExtensions.Template(System.Collections.Generic.Dictionary{System.String,System.Object},System.String,System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Returns a string that replaces the placeholder elements [placeholder] in the {string} template with the matching the dictionary lookup value with the. It will call .ToString() on non-string objects values in the dictionary if necessary.

member.name: M:WildHare.Extensions.ForTemplating.TemplatingExtensions.Template(System.Collections.Generic.Dictionary{System.String,System.Object},System.IO.FileInfo,System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Returns a string that replaces the placeholder elements [placeholder] from the {templateFile} template with the matching the dictionary lookup value with the. It will call .ToString() on non-string objects values in the dictionary if necessary.

member.name: M:WildHare.Extensions.ForTemplating.TemplatingExtensions.Template(System.Object,System.String,System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Returns a string that replaces the placeholder elements [placeholder] in the {string} template with the matching the properties of the current object. It will call .ToString() on non-string objects values in the dictionary if necessary.

member.name: M:WildHare.Extensions.ForTemplating.TemplatingExtensions.Template(System.Object,System.IO.FileInfo,System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Returns a string that replaces the placeholder elements [placeholder] in the {templateFile} template with the matching the properties of the current object. It will call .ToString() on non-string objects values in the dictionary if necessary.

member.name: M:WildHare.Extensions.ForTemplating.TemplatingExtensions.Template``1(``0,System.IO.FileInfo,System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Returns a string that replaces the placeholder elements [placeholder] in the {templateFile} template with the matching the properties of the current object of type <T>. It will call .ToString() on non-string objects values in the dictionary if necessary.

member.name: M:WildHare.Extensions.ForTemplating.TemplatingExtensions.TemplateList``1(System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{``0},System.String,System.String,System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Returns a string that replaces the placeholder elements '[placeholder]' in the string {template} matching the properties for each item of type <T> in the {list}. It will call .ToString() on non-string objects values in the dictionary if necessary. If not null, {lineEnd} is added after each line of text, except for the last line. {startTag} and {endTag} default to '[' and ']' respectively, wrapping the placeholder text but can be customized to the users preferences.

member.name: M:WildHare.Extensions.ForTemplating.TemplatingExtensions.TemplateList``1(System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{``0},System.IO.FileInfo,System.String,System.String,System.String)

member.summary: Gets a list of MetaProperties for the current {type}.

member.name: M:WildHare.Extensions.TypeExtensions.GetMetaProperties``1(System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{``0},System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Gets a list of MetaProperties for the {type} for (T) for use in code generation. You can include either an include or exclude list (but not both) to filter in/out these properties.

member.name: M:WildHare.Extensions.TypeExtensions.GetMetaProperties``1(``0,System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Gets a list of MetaProperties for the Type for the current instance for use in code generation. You can include either an include or exclude list (but not both) to filter in/out these properties.

member.name: M:WildHare.Extensions.TypeExtensions.GetTypesInNamespace(System.Reflection.Assembly,System.String)
member.summary: Given an Assembly, returns a Type array of the types in the {namspace}.

member.name: T:WildHare.MetaProperty
member.summary: Simplified PropertyInfo meta data with custom Get and Set of the instance.
